docs.snippet: Last night that event so threateningly denounced by Gov. LITCHER took place. The "sacred soil" of Virginia received the imprint of thirteen thousand feet on march to the vindication of the Union.

headline.main: OUR WAR CORRESPONDENCE.; The March into Virginia--The Fifth, Twenty-eighth and Sixty-ninth-- New-York State Militia--First Night's Campaigning.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last night that event so threateningly denounced by Gov. LITCHER took place. The "sacred soil" of Virginia received the imprint of thirteen thousand feet on march to the vindication of the Union.

docs.snippet: The James Adger left the dock at New-York on Wednesday afternoon at 5 P.M., and anchored off the Battery until Thursday at 12:30 A.M. at which time she got under weigh and proceeded to sea. We had on board the second Regiment, New-York State...

headline.main: TRIP OF THE JAMES ADGER TO AND FROM FORTRESS MONROE.; THE SECESSION REBELLION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The James Adger left the dock at New-York on Wednesday afternoon at 5 P.M., and anchored off the Battery until Thursday at 12:30 A.M. at which time she got under weigh and proceeded to sea. We had on board the second Regiment, New-York State Volunteers, of Troy, numbering 800 men.

docs.snippet: Gen. PATTERSON, of Philadelphia, and staff, and three hundred troops, have arrived at Fort McHenry. The General visited the encampment at Federal Hill this afternson.

docs.snippet: The Star, formerly the Monticello, one of the war vessels employed by Government in Chesapeake Bay and Hampton Roads, had a very brilliant engagement with a battery of the "rebels of Virginia."
